Kailas Robotics Triumphs at CES 2025 Japan Pavilion's
Global Pitch Battle!

January 9, 2025

January 9, 2025 Las Vegas,　Kailas Robotics, a Japanese startup, has secured victory in the Global Pitch Battle held at the Japan Pavilion during CES 2025. This competition featured five leading robotics companies from around the world, all recipients of CES Innovation Awards. Kailas Robotics distinguished itself with a presentation of its compact and lightweight robotic arm, MobiRobo.
MobiRobo's Innovative Edge
MobiRobo introduces groundbreaking technology that enables precise object manipulation even from unstable platforms—a feat previously deemed unattainable for robotic arms. Its versatility allows integration with drones, unmanned ground vehicles (UGVs), and humanoid robots. These advancements were pivotal in securing the top spot for Kailas Robotics in the competition.
Statement from CSO Shiomi
Chief Strategy Officer Shiomi, who delivered the winning pitch, expressed:
"We are thrilled that our technology and its practical applications have been recognized. We extend our deepest gratitude to the Japanese government, JETRO, and all our supporters for providing us with this invaluable opportunity."
Looking Ahead
This achievement marks a significant milestone for Kailas Robotics as it continues to advance Japanese innovation in robotics on the global stage. The company remains committed to developing technologies that address industrial and societal challenges worldwide.
About Kailas Robotics
Kailas Robotics is a pioneering Japanese company dedicated to developing next-generation robotics technologies aimed at solving societal challenges. The company specializes in providing advanced solutions, including robotic arms designed for mobile platforms.
CES Innovation Award: https://www.ces.tech/ces-innovation-awards/2025/mobirobo/
